lines.text: That techno-rock you guys listen to is gutless.
All right, but when they attack the car, save the radio.
I'll start my diet tomorrow.
You better watch out, because Randy might like the Hollywood lean look.
Yeah, but blimps don't get to go out with Tommy.
Who?
Tommy.
Who?

[in unison]
TOMMY!
Fuck him!

[to Julie after she dumps him]
Well fuck you, for sure, like totally!

[to her friends]
Man, he's like tripendicular, ya know?

[shouting over the noise just as the music ends]
So, when can I see you again?

[embarassed]
Gee, Randy... why don't you wait until the end of the evening to say these things?
It's how I feel. It's what I want.
I'm here with you now.
No one is gonna tell me who I can score with! Now I want this chick, she wants me, so fuck it, we're goin' back.
Like, they're staring right at us.
Gross! Let's move.
[behind the stage curtain at the Valley High junior prom]
Ahh! Stacey! Hey, man, check out Stacey!
I don't wanna see Stacey.
[peeks from behind the curtain in time to see Tommy kiss Julie on the dance floor]
Ugh! That's it! Man, I've had it with you, Bailey!
What? I didn't think her haircut was that bad.
What do you mean, her haircut? I just want to know what the rest of this grand plan of yours is.
No, man, this is it! Simplicity at its finest.
Simplicity at its finest. Well, at least you got us here. So let's...
...crush that fly!
Do you think she really does all the stuff she says?
You know, I think she does. I mean, who could make up 'That stuff tastes like Clorox.'?
So, you wanna dance?
In another life!
Yeah, I didn't either. I was just taking a poll.
Where do you work?
At my parents' store.
What do they sell?
Health foods.
That's cool.
Like, it's not cool at all! Like, it's all this stuff that tastes like nothing and it's supposed to be so good for you. Why couldn't they, like, open a Pizza Hut or something?
It appears as though you forgot our French fries and a Coke, fishhead.
Oh, well, Peter Piper picked a pepper, I guess I did!
Do you believe a girl should pet on the first date?
Who are you, Bozo the Clown?

[about Julie]
Sarah, do you know how much she looks like you?
Do I still look that way?
Better!

[warily surveying party food]
What you got running here, a bait shop?
Like, it's sushi, don't you know?
[points at each platter as she identifies them]
Like, this here is tuna, that's flying fish egg, and that's sea urchin.
This is pistachio paste, isn't it?
[picks up a smear of wasabi with a chopstick and eats it; he then watches party guests enjoying the sushi]
Dig in, Fred.

[shudders]
I think I'll go get something to drink.

[introducing himself to Julie and Stacey]
Hi, I'm Fred. I like tacos and '71 Cabernet. My favorite color is magenta.

[about his recent break-up with Julie]
Who else is there? No other Val dude can touch me. She must really be freaking out.
Yeah, but Tommy can be such a dork, ya know? Like he's got the bod, but his brains are bad news.
But he is bitchin'. You really are so lucky, Julie.
I know, but we've been going together so long now. Like I'm beginning to think I'm a piece of furniture or something, like an old chair!
Oh, bad news!

[glancing at Brad]
I definitely need something new.

[arguing about staying out all night]
Why can't you just punish me like Stacey's parents?
Bad karma, dear!
Fred?
Stacey?
God, you're so weird! Go away!
My little pickle. My darling.
Like, this is so embarrassing.
Well, I think you're cute.
My God.

[while getting his ticket torn by Randy, who is working as an usher and wearing 3-D glasses]
Bitchin'! Is this in 3-D?
No, but your face is.
